alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 3:38PM MST until June 23 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry creeks and washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 PM MST, Although the heavy rainfall had ended, runoff from the earlier downpours will continue to impact the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include...Open wilderness on Mount Lemmon above the town of Catalina and Catalina State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
